Job Title: Senior Financial Analyst

Location: Troy, MI

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Accounting/Auditing, Finance

Description:
365 Retail Markets is the global leader of self-service technology and convenience solutions for the foodservice industry. Through our combination of MicroMarket, vending, and dining technologies, we offer the best-in-class point-of-service platform for the workplace. For the last decade, 365 has been pioneering innovation and winning multiple awards for revolutionizing the market with superior technology, strategic partnerships and ultimate flexibility in customization and branding. At 365, we are committed to supporting our customers’ and employees’ success!The Senior Financial Analyst is a member of the Finance Team and will report to the Corporate Controller. The Senior Financial Analyst will help shape the structure, processes, and culture around many aspects of the Finance department.
Essential Functions & Responsibilities Ensure appropriate internal controls are in place and operating effectively to minimize substantive errors and improve efficiencyProvide audit support for control and substantive testingPerform month end and quarter end reconciliation activities as assignedGenerate and maintain detailed documentation of policies and processes and assist with process improvement/automation initiatives as they ariseResearch and identify international reporting requirementsRegistering or updating sales tax filing status in each stateCoordinate the identification, reporting and follow-up efforts associated with tax related system problems and errors, which will include responding to sales tax noticesProvide analytical support and assistance with respect to all areas of sales/use tax complianceAid in the maintenance of our tax system - Avalara (exemption certificates, filing requirements, etc.)Assist with the setup and maintenance of new international business processes, including operational setup and chart of account mappingEntering tax codes for new and existing products within Avalara
 RequirementsThe ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of Generally Accepted Accounting Principles(GAAP), and will be responsible for overseeing various aspects of the month-end close process3-5+ years of progressive experience in Public AccountingProject management skills, analytical thinker, and effective leaderLeadership in continuous improvement projectsProficient in Microsoft ExcelExemplary interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skillsHighly organized, customer-focused, strong attention to detailBachelor’s degree in finance, accounting, or related field

Experience Level (if available): Associate
